intro: Dorstenia marambensis, commonly known as the Marambense woolly vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, woolly, and often hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
